art.heading: Mali - Kayes
art.content:
MPI stands for Multidimensional Poverty Index, which is where a range of indicators is used to calculate a summary poverty figure for a given population, in which a larger figure indicates a higher level of poverty as noted by  <link="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multidimensional_Poverty_Index."><color=orange>Multidimensional Poverty Index</color></link>  

The overall MPI score for Mali is 0.457, but the regional score is 0.485 as noted in the <link="https://www.kaggle.com/ophi/mpi?select=MPI_subnational.csv"><color=orange> sub-national database located on kaggle.</color></link> that was last updated in 2019.

The percentage of people listed as poor in this region was found to be 82.8%. Of the surveyed regions it has the 3rd highest Intensity of deprivation in the nation at 58.6

art.heading: Linear Regression
art.content: Simple linear regression is a statistical method that allows us to summarize and study relationships between two continuous (quantitative) variables. To learn how to calculate the linear regression  <link="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JvS2triCgOY."><color=orange>watch this video.</color></link>

art.heading: Mean
art.content: the mean is the numerical result of the sum of all the numbers in a given set divided by the total amount of terms. A tool that can be used is <link="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multidimensional_Poverty_Index."><color=orange>is the mean calculator.</color></link>

art.heading: Mode
art.content: The mode is the most common number within the range provided in the dataset

art.heading: Median
art.content: the median is the data value separating the upper half of a data set from the lower half. It is recommended to first sort the dataset before attempting to find the median

art.heading: Standard Deviation
art.content: the standard deviation is the the measure of the spread of the values in a dataset and is found by finding the mean, then for each data point we find the square of the distance between the mean and the data point and add these values, we then divide by the total number of data points and take the square root as the answer. <link="https://www.calculator.net/standard-deviation-calculator.html"><color=orange> This is a link to a standard deviation calculating tool.</color></link>

art.heading: Sampling
art.content: This is the process of using a smaller cluster of data to represent a larger dataset. There is the possibility for sample error as samples can be biased or unrepresentative of the whole population. There are many types of sampling such as : simple Random, systematic, cluster, stratified and convenience

art.heading: Two Sample T-Test
art.content: The two-sample t-test (also known as the independent samples t-test) is a method used to test whether the unknown population means of two groups are equal or not. and is used when the data values are independent, random sampled from two normal populations and the two independent groups have equal variances. <link="https://www.calculator.net/standard-deviation-calculator.html"><color=orange> For more information click this link.</color></link>

art.heading: one sided two Sample T-Test
art.content: Poverty should be fixed give money to all

art.heading: Paired T- Test
art.content: The paired sample t-test, sometimes called the dependent sample t-test, is a statistical procedure used to determine whether the mean difference between two sets of observations is zero.

lvl1Quiz.question: What is meant when someone is asked to find the mode of a dataset?
answers: The numerical result of the sum of all the numbers divided by the total amount of terms
The most common number within the range provided in the dataset
The vibe of a number
The center point of a range of values provided when the dataset is sorted in either ascending or descending order

lvl1Quiz.question: What is meant when someone is asked to find the mean of a dataset?
answers: The numerical result of the sum of all the numbers divided by the total amount of terms
The most common number within the range provided in the dataset
The most aggressive looking number
The center point of a range of values provided when the dataset is sorted in either ascending or descending order

lvl1Quiz.question: What is meant when someone is asked to find the median of a dataset?
answers: The numerical result of the sum of all the numbers divided by the total amount of terms
The most common number within the range provided in the dataset
The number that is most likely to act as a negotiator in a meeting
The center point of a range of values provided when the dataset is sorted in either ascending or descending order

lvl1Quiz.question: What is meant when someone is asked to find the standard deviation of a dataset?
answers: The numerical result of the sum of all the numbers divided by the total amount of terms
The most common number within the range provided in the dataset
The measure of the spread of the values in a dataset
The center point of a range of values provided when the dataset is sorted in either ascending or descending order

lvl1Quiz.question: In a study done by the Oxford Poverty and Human development Initiative as of 2018 it was discovered that Intensity of deprivation on a subnational scale for Mali included the following data points for each of its regions. {58.6, 58.2, 57.8, 59.8, 65.6, 44.9}. What is the average Intensity of deprivation for Mali based on this information to 2 decimal places.

In a study done by the Oxford Poverty and Human development Initiative as of 2018 it was discovered that Intensity of deprivation on a subnational scale for Mali included the following data points for each of its regions. {58.6, 58.2, 57.8, 59.8, 65.6, 44.9}. What is the standard deviation of the Intensity of deprivation for Mali based on this information to 2 decimal places.

In a study done by the Oxford Poverty and Human development Initiative as of 2018 it was discovered that Intensity of deprivation on a subnational scale for Mali included the following data points for each of its regions. {58.6, 58.2, 57.8, 59.8, 65.6, 44.9}. What is the median of the Intensity of deprivation for Mali based on this information
answers: There is no median

lvl1Quiz.question: In a study done by the Oxford Poverty and Human development Initiative as of 2018 it was discovered that Intensity of deprivation on a subnational scale for Mali included the following data points for each of its regions. {58.6, 58.2, 57.8, 59.8, 65.6, 44.9}. What is the mode of the Intensity of deprivation for Mali based on this information
answers: There is no mode

lvl2Quiz.question: Describe the type of association shown in the following scatterplot:
answers: Positive linear association
Negative linear association
Positive curvilinear association
Negative curvilinear association

lvl2Quiz.question: Which of the following plots is best suited to show the linear relationship or association between independent and dependent continuous variables (or co-variables)?
answers: Scatter Plot
Bar Chart
Histograms
None of the above options

lvl2Quiz.question: If there is only one independent variable, how many coefficients will be required to estimate in a simple linear regression model?
answers: One
Two
Three
Zero

lvl2Quiz.question: The covariance in correlation can be explained as:
answers: The strength and direction of the correlation between the co-variables
The direction of the correlation between the co-variables
All of these
An unstandardized version of the correlation coefficient

lvl2Quiz.question: Which of the following is NOT true about regression?
answers: It allows us to see how one affects the other
It expresses the relationship in the form of an equation
It is a technique to make predictions
It can not estimate whether the association is linear or non-linear

lvl2Quiz.question: In the simple linear regression equation, the term a0 represents the Y = a0 + a1 X1 + ... + ak Xk + Error
answers: Independent variable
Intercept
Model parameter
Response variable

lvl2Quiz.question: Correlation and regression are concerned with
answers: the relationship between two categorical variables.
the relationship between two quantitative variables.
the relationship between a quantitative predictor variable and a categorical response variable.
the relationship between a categorical predictor variable and a quantitative response variable.

lvl2Quiz.question: What will be the value of intercept in the regression model for the following data set?

lvl3Quiz.question: The p-value in hypothesis testing represents which of the following:
answers: The probability of observing results as extreme or more extreme than currently observed, assuming that the null hypothesis is true
The probability that the null hypothesis is true, given the observed results
The probability that the observed results are statistically significant, given that the null hypothesis is true
The probability of observing results as extreme or more extreme than currently observed, assuming that the null hypothesis is true

lvl3Quiz.question: A Type I error occurs when a researcher:
answers: Rejects a true null hypothesis
Accepts a false null hypothesis
Rejects a false null hypothesis
Fails to make a decision regarding accepting or rejecting a null hypothesis

lvl3Quiz.question: A Type II error occurs when a researcher:
answers: Rejects a true null hypothesis
Accepts a false null hypothesis
Rejects a false null hypothesis
Fails to make a decision regarding accepting or rejecting a null hypothesis

lvl3Quiz.question: Which of the following p-value will lead to reject the Null hypothesis if the significance level of the test is 5%
In hypothesis testing, the hypothesis that is assumed to be true is called the
answers: Null Hypothesis
Alternative  Hypothesis
Significant Hypothesis
True Hypothesis

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Hello! I am 'The Professor'! What is your name?
pcResponse: It's Bob. Is 'The Professor' your actual name, or just a title?
npcResponse: Hello Ben! Welcome to the Museum!
Joe who- wait... why are you laughing?
Just Ben? ...Well, my actual name is Hugh Jass. You can see why I use my title instead...

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Are you sure that is your name?
pcResponse: Yes, I am sure that I know what my own name is. Thank you very much!
My name is Joe M. Ama.
npcResponse: My apologies, Always good to double check.
Hey Joe M. Ama! Wait...

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Moving on then. Are you aware that you will be undergoing a statistics quiz and that you must get all the answers right to proceed to the next level?
pcResponse: Right and next you'll say that pigs fly
npcResponse: Very good!
Pigs certanly can not fly, however you will need to pass the quiz to progress to the next floor. You see we here at Lig Museum modeled our stairway doors after sphinxes in mythology

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Regardless, Do you know what the mean of a dataset is?
pcResponse: of course I do, do you?
npcResponse: Well then let me explain, the mean is the numerical result of the sum of all the numbers in a given set divided by the total amount of terms
why yes, the mean is the numerical result of the sum of all the numbers in a given set divided by the total amount of terms

lvl1Dialogue.statement: Now, Do you know what the mode of a dataset is?
pcResponse: Does it matter if your just going to tell me anyway?
npcResponse: The mode is the most common number within the range provided in the dataset
I suppose not, the mode is the most common number within the range provided in the dataset

lvl1Dialogue.statement: ok perhaps you know what the median of a dataset is?
pcResponse: Is there any point in me joking around?
npcResponse: Ok then, well the median is the data value separating the upper half of a data set from the lower half.
oh I enjoy a good joke, please tell me one later on. But on to more pressing matters, the median is the data value separating the upper half of a data set from the lower half.

lvl1Dialogue.statement: finally are you aware of how to obtain the standard deviation of a dataset?
npcResponse: Well then let me explain, the standard deviation is the the measure of the spread of the values in a dataset and is found by finding the mean, then for each data point we find the square of the distance between the mean and the data point and add these values, we then divide by the total number of data points and take the square root as the answer

pcResponse: About as well as you understand sarcasm it seems
npcResponse: Well don't worry, you can always talk to me again, before or after the quiz
Ah I have been told by my wife that I am a master at understanding and picking up sarcasm so you should do well. If not don't be afraid to come talk to me again

lvl2Dialogue.statement: Hello! I am 'The Handsome Professor'! What is your name?
pcResponse: It's Ben. Is 'The Professor' your actual name, or just a title?
npcResponse: Hello Ben! Welcome to the Museum!
Joe who- wait... why are you laughing?
Just Ben? ...Well, my actual name is Hugh Jass. You can see why I use my title instead...

lvl3Dialogue.statement: Hello! I am 'The Even More Handsome Professor'! What is your name?
pcResponse: It's Ben. Is 'The Professor' your actual name, or just a title?
npcResponse: Hello Ben! Welcome to the Museum!
Joe who- wait... why are you laughing?
Just Ben? ...Well, my actual name is Hugh Jass. You can see why I use my title instead...
